highlights.para: This chapter explains the windows and XXX of &app;

section.title: Main Window
section.para: The main window. The individual parts of this window are described below.

section.title: Toolbar
section.para: The toolbar is the horizontal bar across the top of the &app; window. It provides access to the most useful map navigation operations:

listitem.para: Back Button. The Back button takes you to the last place you were looking at. It works in a similar way to the Back button in your web browser. No matter how you move the map, clicking Back will undo the movement.
Forward Button. After using the Back button, you can click Forward to return to where you were. It works in a similar way to the Forward button in your web browser.
Zoom-Out Button. Zoom out one level. When you are zoomed out as far as possible, the button will be grayed out and unavailable.
Zoom Slider. The slider allows you to quickly zoom to any level. Click and drag the slider to zoom.
Zoom-In Button. Zoom in one level. When you are zoomed in as far as possible, the button will be grayed out and unavailable.
Search Entry. Read more about searching in the section titled How to Search.

section.para: To hide the toolbar, choose ViewToolbar. To display the toolbar again, choose ViewToolbar again.

section.title: Sidebar
section.para: The sidebar is the vertical bar on the right edge of the &app; window. It has three tabs:

listitem.para: 1.Locations. The Locations list shows a list of types of Locations, and allows you to show or hide each type of Location. For example, you could choose to show all Restaurants. To show a type of Location, set the checkbox next to it to "on" (checked). To hide a type of Location, set the checkbox next to it to "off" (unchecked).

2.Tracks. The Tracks tab shows a list of your Tracks, and allows you to show or hide individual Tracks. To show a Track, set the checkbox next to it to "on" (checked). To hide a Track, set the checkbox next to it to "off" (unchecked).

3.Results. The Results Tab shows a list of the search results from your most recent search. Clicking on a search result will move the map to show you that road or Location. Clicking the Back button on the toolbar will return you to where you previously were.

section.para: To hide the sidebar, choose ViewSidebar. To display the sidebar again, choose ViewSidebar again.

highlights.para: This chapter will show you how to perform searches in &app; and offers some tips for improving the results you get.

section.title: Search Basics
section.para: To start a search, enter search words into the search box in the upper right corner of the main window, and then hit the Enter key on your keyboard. Some example searches you could try now:

listitem.para: 120 Main Street, Orleans, Massachusetts
Buffalo Street, ND
Miami
Arizona

section.para: After performing a search, the search results sidebar tab will automatically be displayed. Click on one of the results to view the location.

note.para: Don't worry about losing your current spot, you can use the Back Button to return to it later.

section.title: Searching for Locations
section.para: The search box can also find places like restaurants, schools, and police stations. Try these searches:

listitem.para: pizza in Portland, OR
coffee shop wifi Cambridge
gas

section.para: Notice that some searches have a city name in them. When you include a city name at the end of your search words, &app; will try to find Places in or near that city.
When you don't specify a city in your search, &app; will find Places nearby where you are currently looking.

listitem.para: When searching in &app;, capitalization doesn't matter. The word PIZZA is treated the same as Pizza and even PiZZa. They will all get the same results.
Punctuation like commas, quotation marks, pluses, minuses, and parentheses are ignored.
Words like "in" or "near" are optional. They wilk not change the results you get.
If you get too many search results, try adding more search words.
If you get too few search results, try removing one or more search words.
